\pard\cf1\f0\fs24\lang1033 ### Turkey - Present continuous 1.\par
\par
Ben bir elma yiyorum. I am eating an apple.\par
Q: <What is the difference with yerim?>\par
A: <That would mean: I eat ; I will eat ; I would eat ; I'd like to eat. So really, anything but "I'm eating right now" :-]>\par
\par
Biz bu kitab\f1\u305? biliyoruz.\f0  We know this book.\par
Q: <What is the difference between tan\f1\u305?mak and bilmek ?\f0 >\par
A: <in general tan\f1\u305?mak is for people (Selcen'i tan\u305?yorum) and bilmek is for things (Kitab\u305? biliyorum)\par
You can also use bilmek with people, but it would usually imply that you know who this person is but you don't really know each other.\f0 >\par
\par
\f2\lang1049\par

TxtContent:
### Turkey - Present continuous 1.

Ben bir elma yiyorum. I am eating an apple.
Q: <What is the difference with yerim?>
A: <That would mean: I eat ; I will eat ; I would eat ; I'd like to eat. So really, anything but "I'm eating right now" :-]>

Biz bu kitabı biliyoruz. We know this book.
Q: <What is the difference between tanımak and bilmek ?>
A: <in general tanımak is for people (Selcen'i tanıyorum) and bilmek is for things (Kitabı biliyorum)
You can also use bilmek with people, but it would usually imply that you know who this person is but you don't really know each other.>
